name: 350 Mass
community: Massachusetts residents, with a focus on marginalized and frontline communities most affected by climate change and environmental injustice
description: 350 Mass is a grassroots organization dedicated to addressing the climate crisis in Massachusetts.
impact: 350 Mass has successfully advocated for policies that promote clean energy, reduce emissions, and protect communities from the impacts of climate change.

name: Extinction Rebellion Boston
description: Grassroots movement demanding action on climate emergency through nonviolent direct action and civil disobedience.
impact: Organizes protests and actions to push for urgent and radical action on climate change.

name: Sunrise Movement Boston
description: Youth-led movement advocating for ambitious and equitable climate action.
impact: Mobilizes young people to demand climate action and has helped pass climate policies at local and national levels.

name: GreenRoots
description: Grassroots organization working on environmental justice and community resilience in Chelsea and East Boston.
impact: Empowers communities to fight for environmental justice and provides resources and education.

name: Mothers Out Front
description: Parent-led movement advocating for climate solutions.
impact: Works to pass climate policies at local and state levels and trains and supports parent activists.

name: The Food Project
description: Empowers youth and promotes food equity and sustainability through urban agriculture.
impact: Engages youth in sustainable agriculture, promotes food equity, and supports local food systems.

name: Boston Cyclists Union
description: Advocates for safe, bike-friendly streets and increased access to biking.
impact: Works to make streets safe and accessible for cyclists, and promotes bicycling as a sustainable transportation option.

name: Clean Water Action
description: National organization working to protect the environment and public health.
impact: Works on issues such as clean water, climate change, and environmental justice through advocacy, organizing, and education.

name: Green Energy Consumers Alliance
description: Nonprofit promoting renewable energy and energy efficiency through advocacy and consumer education.
impact: Helps consumers access clean energy and advocates for policies that support clean energy and energy efficiency.

name: Mystic River Watershed Association
description: Works to protect and restore the Mystic River watershed through advocacy, education, and community engagement.
impact: Improves water quality, restores habitats, and promotes recreational opportunities along the Mystic River.

name: Home Energy Efficiency Team (HEET)
description: Nonprofit promoting energy efficiency and renewable energy in low-income communities.
impact: Helps households reduce energy use and costs, installs solar panels and other renewable energy systems, and advocates for pro-environment energy policies.

name: City Sprouts
community: Youth and families in Cambridge and Boston
description: Nonprofit promoting urban agriculture, food education, and environmental stewardship.
impact: Builds and maintains community gardens, provides food and garden education, and fosters community engagement around food and environmental issues.

name: TransitMatters
description: Advocacy group promoting sustainable and equitable transportation options in Greater Boston.
impact: Conducts research and analysis, advocates for transit policies and investments, and engages the public and policymakers in discussions around transportation issues.

name: Boston Building Resources
community: Homeowners and renters in Greater Boston
description: Nonprofit promoting sustainable and affordable housing through education, advocacy, and resources.
impact: Provides affordable housing materials and services, offers education and training on home improvement and energy efficiency, and advocates for policies that support sustainable and affordable housing.

name: City Compost
description: Composting company providing residential and commercial composting services.
impact: Diverts organic waste from landfills and creates compost that can be used to improve soil health and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

name: Alternatives for Community and Environment (ACE)
community: Communities of color and low-income communities
description: Environmental justice organization promoting community empowerment and sustainability.
impact: Works to address environmental racism and pollution, builds community resilience and leadership, and advocates for policies that support environmental justice.
